alert.note: Alert for Escambia (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 17 at 11:41PM EDT until April 18 at 1:00AM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1100 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN BALDWIN AND SOUTH CENTRAL ESCAMBIA COUNTIES... At 1039 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Robertsdale to near Summerdale to 5 miles northwest of Foley to 3 miles west of Magnolia Springs, moving east at 50 mph. THIS LINE OF DESTRUCTIVE STORMS WILL MOVE ACROSS HIGHWAY 59 FROM JUST EAST OF ROBERTSDALE TO FOLEY. THESE ARE PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS STORMS WITH DESTRUCTIVE WINDS. THEY MAY ALSO PRODUCE TORNADOES WITH LITTLE ADVANCED WARNING. TAKE COVER IMMEDIATELY IN THESE AREAS AS IF A TORNADO WARNING WAS ISSUED. HAZARD...80 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be heavily damaged. Expect considerable damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles. Extensive tree damage and power outages are likely. Locations impacted include... Foley, Orange Beach, Robertsdale, Lillian, Magnolia Springs, Summerdale, Silverhill, Perdido Beach and Elberta. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...80 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. This is an EXTREMELY DANGEROUS SITUATION with tornado like wind speeds expected. Mobile homes and high profile vehicles are especially susceptible to winds of this magnitude and may be overturned. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. These storms have the potential to cause serious injury and significant property damage.
